subject: AI
title: Where to Go from Here
description: Practical next steps after learning AI foundations.

hook.text: You now know what AI is, how it learns, and what can go wrong. The question is: what do you actually do with that knowledge?

buildup.text: If you want to build: learn Python, pick up scikit-learn or PyTorch, and follow a hands-on tutorial. Start with tabular data â€” it's the fastest path to real results.

discovery.text: If you want to apply: learn prompt engineering, understand model limitations, and focus on integrating AI into existing workflows rather than building models from scratch.

twist.text: The biggest mistake is trying to learn everything. Pick one path â€” build, apply, or evaluate â€” and go deep. You can branch later.

climax.text: Build a small project: a spam classifier, a chatbot, a recommendation engine. Nothing cements understanding like shipping something real.

punchline.text: Foundations are done. Now pick a direction and start making things.

quiz.question: What's the best way to solidify AI foundations knowledge?
options: Read more theory before doing anything
